IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To support and operate elephant conservation and education programs, both in managed facilities and in the wild, with an emphasis on management, protection and scientific research.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To support and operate elephant conservation and education programs, both in managed facilities and in the wild, with an emphasis on management, protection and scientific research.
IRS990.Desc: Projects related to African and Asian elephants, both in managed facilities and in the wild, with an emphasis on management, protection and scientific research, education programs about elephant care, management, and issues concerning conservation of wildlife and habitat protection.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization offers grants for insitu and exsitu elephant conservation and research projects. Proposals for funding are subject to peer review and review by the IEF board. All sections of the IEF application must be completed. Resumes of Project Investigators must be included. The application clearly states the criteria for funding and states preferences for certain objectives and priorities. If a project is funded, a grant contract is sent to the Project Investigator for review and signature. The first installment of funding is made only after a signed contract has been received. A six month interim report, including digital photos, is required prior to the second installment. A final report and final budget, again including photos, is required at the end of the funding period. Any future requests for funding will not be considered unless a six month report has already been reviewed and approved. Applications for the same organization or individual will not be considered if reports from prior projects are missing or incomplete.

The organization offers grants for insitu and exsitu elephant conservation and research projects. Proposals for funding are subject to peer review and review by the IEF board. All sections of the IEF application must be completed. Resumes of Project Investigators must be included. The application clearly states the criteria for funding and states preferences for certain objectives and priorities. If a project is funded, a grant contract is sent to the Project Investigator for review and signature. The first installment of funding is made only after a signed contract has been received. A six month interim report, including digital photos, is required prior to the second installment. A final report and final budget, again including photos, is required at the end of the funding period. Any future requests for funding will not be considered unless a six month report has already been reviewed and approved. Applications for the same organization or individual will not be considered if reports from prior projects are missing or incomplete.

The 2022 Form 990 was amended to correct Part VII, Section A. Deborah Olson, Executive Director, was inadvertently checked as an Individual trustee or director, and should have been listed as an Officer. Additionally, Tim Morrow, Mike Fouraker, and Tom Albert were amended to check both Officer and Individual Director to more completely represent their responsibilities with the Foundation. This did not alter any other reporting in the Form 990.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Deborah Olson, Executive Director, is married to Michael Fouraker, Director.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is provided to the full Board of Directors for review prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Conflict of Interest policy is reviewed at each annual meeting. Each director is asked to report any potential conflicts as they arise.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation does not pay the Executive Director's salary directly. That salary is paid by a paymaster organization which then bills the organization for the amounts paid. The Foundation provides guidance on the salary amount, as discussed and reviewed by the Board of Directors. Comparable market data is used to benchmark the salary.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Documents are made available upon request.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: This amended return was filed to correct an oversight in classification of Officers and Directors of the organization in Part VII, Section A - also noted in detail on Schedule O. The error was a good-faith mistake, and did not change any other reporting sections or create any additional schedules to be filed. The organization wanted to correct the filing to ensure transparency to potential donors.
